attractions.name: Eiffel Tower
attractions.location: Champ de Mars, 5 Avenue Anatole, 75007 Paris

police: Police Prefecture, 1 Rue de Lutèce, 75004 Paris
tips: Book Eiffel Tower tickets online to avoid long queues.
Beware of pickpockets in crowded areas like the metro and tourist attractions.
Many museums are free on the first Sunday of each month.

police: Metropolitan Police HQ, Victoria Embankment, London
hospital: St Thomas' Hospital, Westminster Bridge Rd, London
tips: Use an Oyster card for cheaper transport on the Tube and buses.
Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace is a must-see.
Museums like the British Museum and National Gallery are free to enter.

police: Polizia di Stato HQ, Viale del Viminale, Rome
hospital: Policlinico Umberto I, Viale del Policlinico, Rome
tips: Carry a water bottle—Rome has free public fountains with drinkable water.
Wear comfortable shoes, as many streets are cobblestone.
Avoid dining near major tourist sites; prices are much higher.

police: Mossos d'Esquadra HQ, Via Laietana, Barcelona
hospital: Hospital Clínic de Barcelona, Carrer de Villarroel, Barcelona
tips: Pickpocketing is common around La Rambla—stay alert.
Book Sagrada Familia tickets well in advance.
Tapas bars are busiest around 9–10 PM.

police: Amsterdam Police HQ, Elandsgracht 117, Amsterdam
tips: Rent a bike to explore like a local, but stay in bike lanes.
Canal tours are a great way to see the city.
Many shops and cafes only accept card payments.

police: Berlin Police HQ, Platz der Luftbrücke, Berlin
tips: Public transport runs on trust—don’t forget to validate your ticket.
Many attractions are closed on Mondays.
Berlin is very bike-friendly with dedicated bike lanes.

police: Vienna Police HQ, Schottenring, Vienna
tips: Vienna is famous for coffee houses—don’t miss Sachertorte.
A Vienna Card gives discounts on attractions and transport.
The metro runs until midnight, longer on weekends.

police: Prague Police HQ, Jungmannovo nám., Prague
hospital: General University Hospital, Karlovo nám., Prague
tips: Beware of overpriced taxis—use apps like Bolt or Uber.
Try traditional Czech beer and goulash.
The Astronomical Clock shows an hourly show in the Old Town Square.

police: Athens Police HQ, Leof. Alexandras, Athens
tips: Buy a combo ticket for multiple ancient sites to save money.
Summer can be extremely hot—visit early morning or evening.
Beware of pickpockets in crowded metro lines.

police: Istanbul Police HQ, Vatan Cd., Istanbul
tips: Hagia Sophia is free to enter but can be very crowded.
Bargaining is expected at the Grand Bazaar.
Ferries are a cheap and beautiful way to cross between Europe and Asia.

Venice.police: Questura di Venezia, Santa Croce 500, 30135 Venezia
Venice.hospital: Ospedale SS. Giovanni e Paolo, Castello 6777, 30122 Venezia
Venice.tips: Venice is best explored on foot and by vaporetto (water bus). Avoid tourist trap restaurants near St. Mark's Square.

attractions: Cathedral of Santa Maria del Fiore (Duomo)
Florence.police: Questura di Firenze, Via Zara 2, 50129 Firenze
Florence.hospital: Ospedale di Santa Maria Nuova, Piazza Santa Maria Nuova 1, 50122 Firenze
Florence.tips: Book museum tickets in advance. Watch out for pickpockets in crowded areas.

Madrid.hospital: Hospital General Universitario Gregorio Marañón, Doctor Esquerdo 46, 28007 Madrid
Madrid.tips: Metro is the best way to move around. Dinner starts late in Madrid, usually after 9 PM.

Lisbon.police: Comando Metropolitano de Lisboa, Rua Cap. Renato Baptista 8, 1170-087 Lisboa
Lisbon.hospital: Hospital de Santa Maria, Av. Prof. Egas Moniz, 1649-028 Lisboa
Lisbon.tips: Wear comfortable shoes for the hills. Try local pastries like pastéis de nata.

Dublin.police: Store Street Garda Station, Store Street, Dublin 1
Dublin.hospital: Mater Misericordiae University Hospital, Eccles Street, Dublin 7
Dublin.tips: The city is walkable. Expect rainy weather, carry an umbrella.

Edinburgh.police: St Leonard's Police Station, 14 St Leonard's St, Edinburgh
Edinburgh.hospital: Royal Infirmary of Edinburgh, 51 Little France Crescent, Edinburgh
Edinburgh.tips: Be prepared for steep climbs. The Edinburgh Festival in August is very crowded.

Munich.hospital: Klinikum der Universität München, Ziemssenstraße 1, 80336 München
Munich.tips: Public transport is efficient. Beer gardens are family-friendly in Munich.

Copenhagen.police: Københavns Politi, Politigården, Polititorvet 14, 1780 København V
Copenhagen.tips: Rent a bike to explore the city. Copenhagen is expensive, budget accordingly.

Stockholm.tips: Use an SL travel card for transport. Many museums have free entry on certain days.

Zurich.tips: Switzerland is expensive; consider buying food at supermarkets. Trains are very reliable.

police: Brussels Police HQ, Rue du Marché au Charbon, Brussels
tips: Try Belgian waffles and fries from street vendors.
Public transport is easy with a MOBIB card.
Most shops close early on Sundays.

police: Warsaw Police HQ, Nowolipie 2, Warsaw
tips: Visit museums about Poland’s history for context.
Winter is cold; pack warm clothes.
Public transport tickets must be validated.

police: Helsinki Police HQ, Pasilanraitio 13, Helsinki
tips: Saunas are part of daily life—try one.
The city is compact and walkable.
Alcohol is expensive, buy from Alko stores.

police: Kraków Police HQ, Siemiradzkiego 24, Kraków
tips: Day trips to Auschwitz or Wieliczka Salt Mine are popular.
Try pierogi and local Polish dishes.
The Old Town is pedestrian-friendly.

police: Porto Police HQ, Rua da Alegria, Porto
hospital: Centro Hospitalar Universitário do Porto, Largo Prof. Abel Salazar, Porto
tips: Try Francesinha, a local sandwich specialty.
Port wine cellars across the river in Vila Nova de Gaia are a must.
Hilly city—wear good walking shoes.

restaurants.name: Abantal
restaurants.location: Calle Alcalde José de la Bandera 7, Seville

police: Seville Police HQ, Av. Blas Infante, Seville
hospital: Hospital Universitario Virgen del Rocío, Av. Manuel Siurot, Seville
tips: Flamenco shows are a must.
Summers are extremely hot—visit in spring or fall.
Tapas culture is strong—try hopping between bars.

police: Dubrovnik Police HQ, Obala Stjepana Radića 30, Dubrovnik
hospital: General Hospital Dubrovnik, Dr. Ante Starčevića 45, Dubrovnik
tips: Walk the city walls early morning or late evening for fewer crowds.
Game of Thrones fans will recognize filming locations.
Prices in Old Town are higher—eat outside the walls.

police: Reykjavik Police HQ, Hverfisgata 113, Reykjavik
tips: Northern Lights best viewed outside the city in winter.
Blue Lagoon is near the airport—book in advance.
Food and alcohol are very expensive.

police: Tallinn Police HQ, Kolde pst 65, Tallinn
hospital: East Tallinn Central Hospital, Ravi 18, Tallinn
tips: Old Town is compact and easy to walk.
Good base for ferry trips to Helsinki.
Winter is magical with Christmas markets.

police: Luxembourg Police HQ, Rue de Hollerich 201, Luxembourg
hospital: Centre Hospitalier de Luxembourg, 4 Rue Ernest Barblé, Luxembourg
tips: The city is small and walkable.
Great base for day trips to Belgium, France, and Germany.
Public transport is free nationwide.

Budapest.police: Budapest Police Headquarters, Teve utca 4-6, 1139 Budapest
Budapest.hospital: Semmelweis University Hospital, Üllői út 78, 1082 Budapest
Budapest.tips: Buy a Budapest Card for free public transport and discounts. Try the famous thermal baths.

Milan.police: Questura di Milano, Via Fatebenefratelli 11, 20121 Milano
Milan.hospital: Ospedale Niguarda, Piazza dell’Ospedale Maggiore 3, 20162 Milano
Milan.tips: Book Duomo tickets in advance. Aperitivo culture is a must-try in the evenings.

Nice.police: Police Nationale, 1 Rue de la Préfecture, 06300 Nice
Nice.hospital: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Nice, Avenue de la Voie Romaine, 06000 Nice
Nice.tips: Take a stroll on Promenade des Anglais at sunset. Use buses or trains for exploring the French Riviera.

Oslo.tips: Public transport is reliable but expensive. Consider the Oslo Pass for attractions and transport.

Valencia.police: Policía Local Valencia, Av. del Cid 37, 46018 Valencia
Valencia.hospital: Hospital Clínico Universitario de Valencia, Av. de Blasco Ibáñez 17, 46010 Valencia
Valencia.tips: Try authentic paella. Rent a bike to explore Turia Gardens.

Ljubljana.hospital: University Medical Centre Ljubljana, Zaloška cesta 2, 1000 Ljubljana
Ljubljana.tips: The city is very walkable. Take a boat ride on the Ljubljanica River.

Bratislava.tips: Climb up to the castle for panoramic views. Try local Slovak beer and cuisine.

Sarajevo.police: Sarajevo Canton Police, Mehmeda Spahe 20, Sarajevo 71000
Sarajevo.hospital: Clinical Center University of Sarajevo, Bolnička 25, 71000 Sarajevo
Sarajevo.tips: Learn about the city’s history from Ottoman to modern times. Try traditional Bosnian coffee.

Riga.police: Riga Municipal Police, Lomonosova iela 12A, 1003 Riga
Riga.hospital: Pauls Stradiņš Clinical University Hospital, Pilsoņu iela 13, 1002 Riga
Riga.tips: The Art Nouveau district is a must-see. Try Latvian rye bread and local beer.

Vilnius.police: Vilnius Police Headquarters, Saltoniškių g. 19, 08105 Vilnius
Vilnius.hospital: Vilnius University Hospital Santaros Klinikos, Santariškių g. 2, 08661 Vilnius
Vilnius.tips: Visit Užupis, a quirky artists’ district. Walking tours are the best way to explore the Old Town.
